DOC.brief_summary: Adult patients requiring surgery for esotropia will be randomized to surgery under topical anesthesia or sub-Tenon's anesthesia. Amount of surgery required with the two anesthetic procedures will be compared. Motor and sensory outcome of the two treatment groups will also be compared.
DOC.brief_title: Surgery for Esotropia Under Topical Anesthesia
DOC.criteria: Esotropia deviation angle equal to or lower than 45 prism dioptres (requiring one or twomuscle surgery) Visual acuity at least 20/40 in each eye Cooperation for topical anesthesia Paretic or restrictive strabismus Previous eye muscle surgery Significant eye disease other than strabismus
